thread.title: Former Arsenal and England striker Jay Bothroyd sets summer Far East return date after successful stint in Japan
thread.title_full: Former Arsenal and England striker Jay Bothroyd sets summer Far East return date after successful stint in Japan

author: John Cross
title: Former Arsenal and England striker Jay Bothroyd sets summer Far East return date after successful stint in Japan
text:
Former Arsenal and England striker Jay Bothroyd sets summer Far East return date after successful stint in Japan Former England striker Bothroyd, 34, has agreed a pre-contract to sign on July 1 Share Bothroyd had a hugely successful two years in Japan - scoring 35 goals in 54 games Share Get Arsenal FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Jay Bothroyd has agreed a deal to return to the Far East this summer. 
Former England striker Bothroyd, 34, has agreed a pre-contract to sign on July 1 after being a massive hit for J League club Jubilo Iwata. 
Bothroyd had a hugely successful two years in Japan - scoring 35 goals in 54 games - but has had some personal issues as to why he did not return to Asia sooner. 
But Bothroyd has become one of English football’s most successful exports of recent times and and was keen to go back to Japan. The former Arsenal striker has agreed a pre-contract to sign in the Far East on July 1 
Ex-Cardiff and QPR striker Bothroyd, a former Arsenal trainee who also enjoyed stints at Coventry, Italian outfit Perugia, Charlton and QPR, has one of the most successful goals to minutes ratios in Asia and has had several offers. Read More This compilation of Arsenal fan videos shows just how bad the Gunners' meltdown has become 
But Bothroyd was keen to return to Japan’s thriving football set-up and has now got his wish from this summer. 
Four games into the new season, his former club Jubilo are 11th in the J League with one win and one draw - eight points adrift of unbeaten pace setters Vissel Kobe. FC Tokyo are in second place. poll loading Do you think Jay Bothroyd will be a success in Japan? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
